# Advanced Procurement Notice (APN) - Construction of the Next Generation Fighting Vehicle Facility

## Overview
The Canadian government intends to contract for the construction of a new facility for the storage and light maintenance of a fleet of fighting vehicles. The project is expected to be located within the Garrison Petawawa compound and will involve the construction of a 2,700m² facility with an estimated value of $16,000,000.

## Notice Type
This is an Advance Procurement Notice (APN), not a bid solicitation. The purpose of this notice is to provide interested contractors with an opportunity to begin the sponsorship process for obtaining the required security clearance(s) for the project. It is essential to note that there is no guarantee that the project will proceed or that the necessary security clearance(s) will be granted.

## Project Description
The construction project encompasses the development of a new facility to accommodate a fleet of fighting vehicles. The facility will be built within the Garrison Petawawa compound, and the estimated construction value is $16,000,000. The procurement model for this contract will be Modified Design Build.

## Security Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, a contractor must hold a valid and active Facility Security Clearance (FSC) at the level of SECRET, granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Interested contractors without the necessary security clearance(s) should apply for sponsorship through the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Defence Construction Canada (DCC).

## Sponsorship Process
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) will provide preliminary assistance with the security clearance sponsorship process. Contractors interested in participating in the project should submit a sponsorship request application to DCC, providing the necessary information, including the contract number and level of clearance requested.

## Contract Award and Security Requirements
Contractors must have actively held the required security clearance(s) at the time of closing to be eligible for contract award. The contractor acknowledges that the processing of the sponsorship request package or security clearance application is subject to the respective terms, conditions, and timelines of DCC's ISP sponsorship process and the CSP, PWGSC's security clearance granting process.
